costArchitecture.individuals: Free for personal Gmail accounts during preview

installation.commandLine: agy (installed via Configure your Editor settings)

globalRules.description: Global rules that apply to all projects
globalRules.purpose: Personal coding philosophy, language preferences, documentation standards

workspaceRules.description: Project-specific rules that override global rules

globalWorkflows.description: Saved prompts available globally via / commands

globalSkills.description: User-specific skills available across all projects

browserAllowlist.format: Plain text, one domain per line

planning.description: Agent plans before executing tasks. Use for deep research, complex tasks, or collaborative work.
planning.behavior: Organizes work in task groups, produces Artifacts, thoroughly researches and plans

fast.description: Agent executes tasks directly. Use for simple tasks like renaming variables or running commands.

cognitiveArchitecture.planningMode: Explicit - Generates Task Lists and Implementation Plans before coding
cognitiveArchitecture.selfCorrectionCapability: High - Includes 'Explain and fix' and 'Send problems to agent' workflows
cognitiveArchitecture.orchestrationPattern: Asynchronous Agent Manager handling parallel task execution

off.description: Never auto-execute terminal commands except those in Allow list

auto.description: Agent decides whether to auto-execute based on internal safety models

turbo.description: Always auto-execute terminal commands except those in Deny list
turbo.warning: High Risk - Not recommended for enterprise use

alwaysProceed.description: Agent will not stop to ask for permission to run JavaScript in browser

requestReview.description: Agent will always stop to ask for permission to run JavaScript

disabled.description: Agent will never run JavaScript code in browser

secureMode.description: Enhanced security controls restricting access to external resources
secureMode.features: Several security measures enforced to protect environment

reviewDrivenDevelopment.note: Good balance - agent makes decisions and returns for approval

agentDrivenDevelopment.description: Agent will never ask for review

allowListTerminalCommands.location: Advanced Settings → Terminal → Allow List Terminal Commands
allowListTerminalCommands.usage: With 'Off' policy, only listed commands auto-execute

denyListTerminalCommands.location: Advanced Settings → Terminal → Deny List Terminal Commands
denyListTerminalCommands.usage: With 'Turbo' policy, listed commands require approval

browserUrlAllowlist.location: Advanced Settings → Browser → Browser URL Allowlist → Open Allowlist File
browserUrlAllowlist.purpose: Prevent prompt injection from compromised sites

rules.purpose: System instructions - passive, persistent guidelines always 'on'
rules.behavior: Agent considers these before generating any code or plan
useCases: Language preferences (e.g., Always use TypeScript over JavaScript)
Security guidelines (e.g., Never generate hardcoded API keys)

workflows.purpose: Saved prompts triggered on demand with / commands

rulesAndWorkflows.precedence: Workspace rules in .agent/rules/ override global GEMINI.md rules

skills.purpose: Agent-triggered capabilities invoked via natural language semantic matching
skills.distinction: Unlike slash commands - agent decides when to use based on task matching

structure.SKILL.md: Required - Brain of the skill with metadata and instructions
structure.scripts/: Optional - Executable scripts for complex operations
structure.templates/: Optional - Template files for code generation

name.description: Unique identifier, defaults to directory name if not provided

description.description: Most important field - trigger phrase for LLM semantic matching
description.bestPractice: Be precise, not vague. Include specific use cases.

body.goal: Clear statement of what skill achieves
body.examples: Few-shot examples of inputs and outputs

scriptIntegration.purpose: Delegate execution for binary operations, calculations, legacy system interaction

mcpSupport.feature: MCP Store for one-click installation of connectors
mcpSupport.refreshing: Click Refresh button in MCP panel after config changes

artifactGeneration.browserRecordings: Video of UI validation (proof of work)
artifactGeneration.purpose: Build trust through behavioral review (watching videos) not just code review (reading diffs)

agentManager.description: Mission Control for managing autonomous agents
capabilities: Dispatch multiple agents to work in parallel

editor.description: VS Code-based editor for human verification and code editing

browser.description: Integrated browser for opening URLs, DOM interaction, JavaScript execution

secretDetection.method: Integrated IAM using Google Cloud credentials

promptInjectionProtection.browserAllowlist: Restrict agent to trusted domains only
promptInjectionProtection.purpose: Prevent attacks from compromised documentation sites

steps: Choose setup flow (import from VS Code/Cursor or fresh start)
Sign in to Google (personal Gmail account)

openWorkspace.note: Can skip and open workspace later

undoChanges.method: ↩️ Undo changes up to this point in chat

modelSelection.location: Model Selection dropdown in Agent Manager
modelSelection.quotaNote: Gemini 3 Pro has limited free quotas during preview

workspaceAwareness.level: Deep - 'Mission Control' over entire project structure
workspaceAwareness.indexingStrategy: Full-codebase indexing with Mission Control oversight

extensionEcosystem.vscodeExtensions: Supports standard VS Code extensions (with some limitations)

security: Configure Allow List when using 'Off' policy
Configure Deny List to block rm, rmdir, sudo, curl, wget
Set up Browser URL Allowlist for trusted domains only
Restart Antigravity after changing allow/deny lists
rules: Keep global GEMINI.md for personal preferences
skills: Write precise descriptions for semantic matching
Include Goal, Instructions, Examples, Constraints in SKILL.md body
workflows: Share workspace workflows with team via version control
agentUsage: Use Planning mode for complex tasks
Use Fast mode for simple, localized tasks
Review Artifacts (task lists, recordings) before accepting
Use Undo to revert unwanted changes

comparisonToOtherAgents.paradigm: Mission Control GUI - maximalist, agent-first approach
comparisonToOtherAgents.philosophy: AI is primary actor, human is supervisor/architect/manager
comparisonToOtherAgents.differentiator: Explicit Planning Mode with Task Lists and Implementation Plans before coding
comparisonToOtherAgents.artifactTrust: Proof of work via browser recordings and screenshots
